justification: "We measured lay beliefs in physiognomy with the physiognomic belief scale (Jaeger et al., 2020; 2022). Participants were prompted to imagine seeing the passport photo of a stranger..."

topic_or_construct: Belief in biological determinism of personality traits
justification: "Following previous investigations, we measured belief in biological determinism of personality traits by showing participants a list of nine personality traits… We asked them to rate how much each trait is based on biological nature (genes, brain structure, etc.)."

measured_by: Entity Beliefs Scale (8-item measure adapted from Levy et al., 1998)
justification: "Belief in the entity theory of personality was measured with eight items (e.g., 'The kind of person someone is, is something basic about them, and it can't be changed very much') adapted from Levy and colleagues (1998)."

measured_by: Belief in a Just World Scale
justification: "Belief in a just world was measured with seven items (e.g., 'I feel that people get what they deserve') adapted from Lipkus (1991)."
"Faith in intuition was measured with twelve items (e.g., 'I trust my initial feelings about people') adapted from Epstein and colleagues (1996)."

"Cognitive reflection was measured with the seven-item cognitive reflection test (CRT; e.g., 'If you are in a race and you pass the person in second place…') adapted from Thomson and Oppenheimer (2016)."
"The need to evaluate was measured with sixteen items (e.g., 'I form opinions about everything') adapted from Jarvis and Petty (1996)."

measured_by: Mean confidence ratings across 20 facial judgment trials
justification: "On each trial participants… rated their confidence in the accuracy of their judgment on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 9 (extremely). We then averaged participants' confidence ratings across the 20 trials."
